# Queens County, New Brunswick

Queens County (; 2021 population 10,998) is located in south central New Brunswick, Canada. The county shire town is the village of Gagetown. The county was named as an expression of loyalty to the Crown and to commemorate a group of earlier settlers originally from Queens County, New York.
Geography
The county's geography is dominated by the Saint John River and Grand Lake. Coal mining is a major industry in the Minto area.  Forestry and mixed farming dominate the rest of the county.  The CFB Gagetown military training area takes in a large portion of the western part of the county.

Demographics
As a census division in the 2021 Census of Population conducted by Statistics Canada, Queens County had a population of  living in  of its  total private dwellings, a change of |10472|1}} from its 2016 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of  in 2021.
